text: the death toll is even higher than
originally feared police initially
thought between twenty to fifty people
died in the back of this refrigerated
lorry forensic teams worked through the
night extracting the bodies of this
facility in Nichols daav it was a grim
task the corpses were badly decomposed
and today the true scale of the tragedy
was revealed we have been able to
inspect the vehicle and we have secured
bodies we have to tell you that 71
persons have been killed in this tragic
incidents 59 men eight women and four
children lost their lives one was a
toddler under two years old police think
they probably suffocated a travel
document found inside the vehicle
suggest this was a group of Syrian
refugees
Austria's interior minister said it was
time for countries in Europe to work
together to tackle the problem and Kim
we need to have a zero tolerance
attitude to human traffickers but the
most important thing in the fight is to
understand that it isn't down to one
nation it's an international problem
interludes who know the police forces in
Austria and Hungary have been working
together to try and find the driver and
today three arrests have been made in
connection with the investigation the
lorry left Budapest on Wednesday and
police think the refugees may have been
dead even before they reached Austria
tens of thousands of migrants and
refugees have been trying to make their
way to Europe in recent months as more
desperate people arrive it's feared
incidents like this have become more
common Bethany Bell BBC news
